newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait Cement asks bids for clinker plant.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait Cement asks bids for clinker plant.

text.p: Kuwait Cement Company (KCC) said on Tuesday it had invited bids from international firms to build a one million tonne a year clinker plant.
"The plant would have a capacity of one million tonnes (per year) expandable to two million in latter stages," a KCC official said.
He refused to give the value of the project but said the closing date for offers by pre-qualified bidders was set for the third week of October.
The plant, to be built in al-Shuaiba industrial area south of Kuwait City, is expected to take three years to complete.
KCC has not yet decided on financing options.
"That depends on the offers we receive," said the KCC official, adding that the firm had already received a loan offer from a Kuwaiti bank for the project.
The company's majority shares are owned by state institutions. It has a capital of 29.6 million dinars ($98.6 million).
